reviews.text: Following the reviews we read, we thought we would have a pleasant lunch last Saturday. We were delayed on the way there and entered the restaurant at 1.30pm without having booked.
reviews.title: Very disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I explained the situation and looked around as I was talking to check that there was any spare table left. the restaurant was fairly quiet but to my amazement, the lady behind the bar cut me short and said. "sorry we are fully booked in a very sharp way which meant get out, I cannot be bothered!!!"
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.text: On one hand we were disappointed as the menu looked very interesting but we thought that if the staff are that unpleasant , we were better off going somewhere else. We ended up having a very nice meal at Le Darnethal were the couple were courteous and polite, the meal was very good and the bill reasonnable. What a shame!
reviews.title: Great value Plat de Jour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel on our way back to Calais. The room we stayed in was OK but not 'overly roomy' but it did the job for one night....a bit more of a traditional French hotel. However the Restaurant by far makes up for the room. As it was a Sunday evening we were not 100% sure what restaurants would be open in the town, so we decided to eat at the hotel...what a great choice that was. The food throughout the meal was outstanding very tasty and the presentation was first class. The 'walled' town of Montreuil-sur-Mer is a lovely place to visit, full of character and a variety of restaurants and bars to choose from. In the past we have stayed at Hermitage Hotel (part of Best Western), but I think that the character and the food of Le Patio gives it that 'french feel'
reviews.title: Lovely food, customer service poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here by chance for a place to eat which did not have meat as it's main course. It was our lucky day! We were welcomed warmly and shown to a table in lovely surroundings. We started with delicious cheese flan served warm with a lovely side salad. It was followed by cod fillet with roasted vegetables served in a chefy piled up style. We asked for them to leave out the chorizo which they were happy to do. The meal was completed with a lovely strawberry tart served on a neat slate platter. We had a small carafe of red wine and the bill came to €37. A real bargain. The meal wasn't huge but it was lunch so was a perfect size for mid day. We thought the whole experience was delightful.
reviews.title: A real surprise!

reviews.text: Hotel: sweet and charming hotel in the centre of the village. However if your room is facing the road I suspect it will be very noisy from traffic. Nice bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Great value, charming, but single room only if you are less than 5 foot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: the double we booked we small but nice. However the single was awful. It had room as it was on two levels but it was dingy as its in the eaves of the building. I am 5'10" and I could banged my head about 5 times in the bathroom, including when using the loo! There is a shower hose but its not a shower and you bang your head if you stand up but the tub is tiny so you can't have a bath. However it was spotlessly clean and overall good value at 50 euros (65 for the small double).
reviews.title: Poor room

reviews.text: We arrived on a wednesday; very welcoming owner who then advised us that the bar and restaurant were closed that night. My better half had spoken to her on the phone to book the night and she failed to advise us of this. Our room was up steep stairs on the 1st floor and was very small, dark & dingy withy no bedside table or side light, only 1 coat hanger and a small not particularly nice shower room. No Sky t.v. There was only 1 other person staying at the hotel besides us and were left on our own o/night with just an emergency contact no. Breakfast was the usual bread, croissants etc but in a very pleasant room and with good coffee. Were sorry we couldn't try the restaurant as the surroundings look very good. Maybe we had such a poor room because the dog was with us but certainly wouldn't stay in that room again and it was poor value for the money. Would however try the restaurant on a future occasion.
reviews.title: Warm, honest, friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very warm welcome, honest and friendly staff, authentic surroundings and rooms, and excellent food! Not cheap, but value for money for stay, food and drinks. Renewed menu has got interesting choices along with a solid wine card.
reviews.title: maybe we just got the wrong day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd booked to stay overnight at Le Patio last Wednesday on an overnight trip to France. We'd been to Montreuil (beautiful, atmospheric town, even more for Les Mis lovers) many times before, but this hotel's restaurant was rated no 2 on Trip Advisor, so we decided to try it.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel and restaurant. Very individual and friendly

reviews.text: Booked restaurant online from UK so can't comment on accommodation. When we arrived we were told there was no reservation. Place did not seem very busy on a Sunday night. Staff were unhelpful and rude. No alternatives suggested so we went next door to Les Hauts de Montreuil and had a great meal!
reviews.title: Table booked but not welcome

reviews.text: We have eaten at Le Patio a number of times now and it definitely our No. 1 restaurant of choice in Montreuil. This visit we went with friends and booked rooms (2 doubles and a single) so that we could enjoy our French gastro meal and waddle upstairs to bed when we were ready.
reviews.title: Wonderful Restaurant with Rooms

reviews.text: We find the owners very friendly. Madame is your hostess and Monsieur is the excellent chef. They recognise us now and are warm and welcoming when we visit.
reviews.title: Cannot be trusted to honour reservations

reviews.text: The restaurant is spacious and smart, but not intimidating. The owners have recently added a lovely glass extension to the back and there are also tables in the garden. We were lucky enough to have a table in the new extension and enjoyed another fabulous meal. You choose from a set menu. Some of the dishes have a small supplement (for example, the steak or if you want 12 oysters, rather than 6). We find the cost very reasonable for the quality of the food. All 5 of us had something different from the menu and absolutely everything we ate was just delicious. The food is fresh and local and the chef, in our opinion, is very skilled.
reviews.title: Very French. Very pleasant - accommodation & food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms upstairs (I think there are 5?) are clean and nicely decorated. We have stayed in two of the double rooms and liked both. They are not luxurious, but they are smart and for the price (we paid 60 euro) they are fantastic value. The bathrooms are new and the bed linen is fresh and white. Very comfortable. No. 30 is my favorite. One thing I would say is that if you are a light sleeper, then take ear plugs. Remember that this is a very old, traditional French building so there is some creaking when other guests are walking up/down the stairs plus the restaurant is on the main road coming into town. It's not majorly noisy, but because I am a light sleeper I take this precaution myself to ensure I get a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Friday 24th February 2012 Dinner

reviews.text: Overnight stop for 2 couples as we toured around before going to Le Touquet.
reviews.title: Excellent-who drank all the wine?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely little town with a market which brings the place to life.
reviews.title: Great short break for food and wine

reviews.text: Le Patio is better than most French B&B's in that has a bar with atmosphere great food both for the evening meal and breakfast the following day and the rates are very reasonable.
reviews.title: A welcomed discovery

reviews.text: Rooms comfortable and with decent en-suite facilities though some of them look a long climb up the stairs.
reviews.title: Cozy - but warm and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hosts very accommodating and friendly
reviews.title: Average
